task.summary: Create domain entity classes - Person, Professional (extends Person), Patient (extends Person), PatientRecord (aggregated into Patient) and Consultation (a Collection of Consultation instances inside PatientRecord). closes #14
Create Java Collection-based DB class oriented to the Person entity. closes #15

Create repository classes - Person, Patient and Profession - and implement methods inside each for INSERTing and SELECTing these entity instances data into and from the DB. Updated Db class with the adding of @Component. closes #16
Create Service interfaces and impl classes for Patient and Professional. closes #17

Create bootstrap data loading classes: ConsultationLoad, PatientLoad and ProfessionLoad. After being populated by the BootstrapDataConfiguration, these should be injected into the Controllers for them to be able to add all bootstrap data into the DB through the also injected service interfaces. closes #18
Create bootstrap data class ExternalizedPropertiesLoader for reading properties' values from txt and YAML files. closes #19

Create bootstrap data loading classes' configuration class: BootstrapDataConfiguration. Which should have the ExternalizedPropertiesLoader injected, for getting the externalized properties' String list values, mount these data into real entity object lists and populate the load classes previously created (ConsultationLoad, PatientLoad and ProfessionLoad). Create DbConfiguration class. closes #20

Create the Controller classes for Patient and Professional. Inject into them the respective service interfaces and implement methods for adding the entities, for adding a Consultation for a Patient, for showing an individual Patient and for showing the complete list of Patients and Professionals. closes #21

Create separate properties files (.txt / .yml) for Consultation, Patient and Professional externalized properties data to be read from. Only bootstrap data (initial app loading data) should be put at these files. Later data should be added from within the application itself - through service interfaces and controllers, and all data managed from the DB after the initial load. closes #23

Use and test all Controller methods, and application functionalities as a whole, from the Main class. Update Db class again to remove @Component (this class bean is configured at its @configuration java class not through @Component Annotations). closes #24
